title: 3 are held in fatal van crash on I-70
body:
Federal immigration agents arrested three people on suspicion of alien smuggling two days after a van packed with 
migrant workers crashed on Interstate 70, killing five and injuring 15 more.

Gelson Mancilla-Santiago, 22, of Guatemala, and two other passengers in the van were in federal custody 
Tuesday, said Carl Rusnok, a spokesman for the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency.

Investigators believe that Mancilla-Santiago was the driver of the van that rolled off Interstate 70 just west of 
Columbia, Mo., shortly before 7 a.m. Sunday. The workers were heading east in search of better jobs on the East 
Coast.

The 15 injured passengers were taken to area hospitals in Columbia on Sunday. Passengers told the Missouri 
Highway Patrol that the driver had fallen asleep at the wheel, the patrol said.

Immigration agents on Tuesday asked the U.S. attorney's office in Kansas City to charge Mancilla-Santiago with 
alien smuggling, Rusnok said. Mancilla-Santiago and two other passengers were being held Tuesday night at a jail 
in Shawnee County, Kan. Rusnok said Mancilla-Santiago has been deported from the United States twice before.

The 2001 Chevrolet van that crashed had California license plates and was scheduled to make stops in New York, 
Washington, South Carolina and Georgia, Rusnok said.
